strIntroduction: This Segway tour will show you the beautiful city of Bergen and you will get a once in a lifetime segway experience in the mountains.

Visit Frogner Park (commonly known as Vigeland Park), the Holmenkollen Ski Jump and three top Oslo museums on a half-day city tour of Oslo! Travel between each must-visit attraction by coach, and learn all about each site from an expert guide.
strTitle: All-Inclusive Oslo City Tour: Viking Ship Museum, Vigeland Park, Polarship Fram Museum and Kon-Tiki Museum

strIntroduction: Enjoy a dog sledding trip into white landscapes, through beautiful wilderness. After your trip you can relax with a hot meal served in the traditional Sami herdsmen’s tent- lavvu!

Save time and money during your Oslo visit with Oslo Pass. With a choice between a 24, 48 or 72 hour card, Oslo Pass offers free admission to a selection of over 30 attractions, museums, and tours for one low pre-paid price.
Try an exciting dog sledding trip into a beautiful winter landscape!
On the Hardangerfjord in a nutshell round trip, you will experience a journey through a landscape of majestic mountains, roaring waterfalls and idyllic orchards.

Enjoy a dose of snow-filled fun on this 2.5-hour winter activity camp experience from Tromsø. With a local guide, travel outside the city to enjoy a variety of exciting winter pursuits. Ride toboggans down icy hillsides, plod through the woodland on snowshoes and try cross-country skiing or ice-skating. Relax by the campfire with a hot drink and cake as your guide shares stories about the surrounding Arctic landscape. No winter sports experience is necessary and activities are suitable for all the family.
strTitle: Tromso Winter Adventure: Snowshoeing, Tobogganing and Cross-Country Skiing

strIntroduction: Be Superman for a day and learn to fly in Scandinavia's first wind tunnel in Voss!

Climb aboard a wooden sailing ship for a 3-hour cruise of the Oslo fjords. Pass a maze of green islands, and sit back to enjoy the cinematic scenery. Savor the fresh flavor of fjord shrimps at a dinner buffet, with hot and cold drinks from the bar.
Day trip rafting with lunch on the river Sjoa, the most famous river for rafting in Northern Europe. Sjoa offers quality rafting for both beginners and the experienced.
strTitle: Rafting Day Trip on the Sjoa River

strIntroduction: Looking for an alternative outdoor activity to skiing and hiking this winter? During a snowshoe hike you will be rewarded with stunning snowy landscapes and a winter fjord view.
Experience the magnificent Lysefjord, the Pulpit Rock (Preikestolen), wild and beautiful coastal scenery, the popular Norway in a nutshell trip.
strTitle: Pulpit Rock & Norway in a Nutshell

strIntroduction: Relax on this three-hour evening boat cruise around Oslo’s harbor and the northern end of the Oslofjord.

Spend an evening aboard a wooden sailboat in Oslo, and sail around the waters of Oslo Fjord. A great way to see the waterfront sights as the sun goes down, this 3-hour boat cruise follows a route past Akershus Fortress, Oslo Opera House and more. Cruise around the pretty islets of the fjord, and enjoy a snack of shrimps as you go.
strTitle: Norwegian Evening Cruise on the Fjord

strIntroduction: On this walking tour of Oslo you’ll be introduced to the unique flavors of the deep valleys and the remote fishing villages as you taste regional specialties. Visit out-of-the-way places, see historical sites, and taste locally made beers as well.
strTitle: Oslo Food and Beer: 4-Hour Walking Tour

strIntroduction: Cycle the flat city center streets of Oslo exploring all the major highlights. Bike in a leisurely fashion past the castle of Akershus Festning, City Hall, Royal Palace, Oslo Fjord, and much more.

Enjoy a four hour bike tour through an immense wilderness called the marka, full of wild berries, dozens of lakes, moose, and stunning views of Oslo and the fjord below.
strTitle: Oslo: Forest to Fjord Bike Tour

strIntroduction: The Sognefjord, Norway’s longest and deepest fjord, extends more than 200 km inland to the foot of the Jotunheimen mountains. This area is said to be one of the most beautiful travel destinations in the world.

strIntroduction: Tour the world-renowned Hermitage Museum in St. Petersburg with a 3-hour guided visit. Walk the reception halls of the Winter Palace, and tour the art gallery to behold the great masterpieces of Western European art. Then explore the rest at leisure.
strTitle: St. Petersburg: Skip-the-Line Hermitage Museum Tour

strIntroduction: The Kremlin is Russia's main museum and the residence of the President. Take this exciting opportunity to get inside the 15th-century fortress and tour its vast territory and world-class museums.

Go on an 8-hour journey from Stockholm to the outer archipelago, cruising the shallow Strömma Canal on board the only boat capable of navigating the narrow passages. Disembark to explore the island’s bohemian streets, and enjoy classic Swedish food.
strTitle: Canal Tour to Sandhamn from Stockholm

strIntroduction: Spend some time paddling leisurely in a double sea kayak while taking in the stunning views of Stockholm from the water. Stockholm, often referred to as the Venice of the North, is spread over 14 islands and linked by 57 bridges.

Enjoy a guided walk in Stockholm’s Old Town area, known as Gamla Stan. Your guide will take you through Stortorget, the city’s main square, tell you about Stockholm’s history, and show you some of the oldest spots in the city that visitors rarely see.
strTitle: Old Town Walkabout - Guided Walking Tour

strIntroduction: Tour the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Birka, departing by boat from Stockholm. Dating back to the 8th century, Birka was perhaps Sweden's earliest city, and this excursion will reveal the settlement's historical Viking treasures.
strTitle: Birka: Viking City – Boat Trip from Stockholm City Hall

strIntroduction: Skip the long lines for taxis, or the hassle of navigating public transport upon arrival at Stockholm International Airport, and enjoy a private, chauffeur driven transfer to your city hotel in a stylish, comfortable, and luxurious vehicle.

Enjoy a tasty 4-hour brunch on board an elegant sea restaurant and sail past Gothenburg and the island of Hisingen, the 4th largest and most populous island in Sweden. Taste typical Swedish produce, such as marinated salmon, local sausages, and more.

Sightseeing by Stockholm’s oldest sightseeing boats is a fun, beautiful and comfortable way to experience the city. You can hop on and hop off at the various stops as often as you like, or stay onboard and enjoy the ride. The ticket is valid for 24 h.

Enjoy a tasty 4-hour dinner on board an elegant cruise boat, and sail past Gothenburg and the island of Hisingen; the 4th largest and most populous island in Sweden. Taste gourmet Swedish produce, such as fennel and baked salmon from the à la carte menu.
strTitle: Hisingen Island Dinner Cruise From Gothenburg

strIntroduction: All of Stockholm in your hand for 24 H – save time and money with Stockholm Pass. Discover the city with numerous benefits and discounts.

Take a trip into rural Sweden as the sun sets and see moose, wild boar, and roe deer just 20 minutes from Stockholm city center. You’ll enjoy a short hike in the forest as well as a hot drink and snacks on this unique 4-hour excursion.
This is a combined bus sightseeing and guided walking tour which shows you the whole of Stockholm's inner city.
strTitle: Stockholm Panorama and Old Town Walk

strIntroduction: Explore Stockholm by bus and boat on this 3.5-hour tour that covers all of the city's highlights. Aboard a comfortable coach, tour the city's highlights like Stadshuset (City Hall), the island of Djurgården, the Vasa Museum and Kungliga Slottet (the Royal Palace). Then hop on to a canal boat to cruise around the city's scenic archipelago and end with a fantastic photo op of the coastal city's skyline.
strTitle: Stockholm in a Bus and Boat

strIntroduction: Get a unique souvenir of your time in Stockholm with a private 30-minute to 2-hour photo shoot in front of famous monuments or picturesque neighborhoods. Your personal photographer will create personalized full size images to share and print.

Abisko is one of the best places in the world for seeing and experiencing the Northern Lights. Join the 6 days trip to admire the stunning views in Abisko.
Embark on a full day fishing tour. Your guide is a fisherman from the archipelago islands, and from Vaxholm you will travel in his little fishing boat.
strTitle: Full Day Fishing in the Archipelago of Stockholm

strIntroduction: Explore Stockholm’s closest archipelago on a return or 1-way cruise to the island of Fjäderholmarna. Take a walk through the town’s colorful streets and artisan shops, stay as long as you like, and enjoy some of the island's charming restaurants.
strTitle: Fjäderholmarna Return or 1-Way Cruise from Stockholm

See the highlights of Stockholm’s Old Town as day turns to night on a 2-hour sunset bike tour along traffic-free bike paths. Discover hidden gems in the Östermalm neighborhood, marvel at the natural wonders of Djurgården Island, and more.

One of the best ways to explore Stockholm’s many islands is by bike. An expert guide will show you the city’s major attractions and some of its hidden gems as well. The Royal National City Park is also included on this tour.

Climb aboard a classic ship and cruise Stockholm’s archipelago on a 3-hour lunch or dinner cruise. Experience the unspoiled nature of the city’s waterways, and enjoy a delicious lunch or dinner of classic chef-prepared Swedish and international cuisine.
strTitle: Archipelago Cruise at Lunch or Dinnertime to Vaxholm

strIntroduction: Enjoy an exciting photography tour of the picturesque city of Stockholm. Tour the Swedish capital's most famous sights, including the Royal Palace, City Hall, and the beautiful King's Garden park, and discover the best shooting angles from your guides.
strTitle: Best of Stockholm: Guided Photography Tour

strIntroduction: Christmas is one of Sweden's most beloved holidays and the preparations begin weeks in advance. Follow your guide on a stroll through the Old Town to learn all about how the Swedes celebrate Christmas today, and how they did so in ancient times.
strTitle: Christmas Spirit in Stockholm - Walking Tour

strIntroduction: Explore the shoreline and the heights of Stockholm on a Segway! On this 2-hour tour you'll see the city's magnificent waterfront, the lovely green setting of the old prison island of Långholmen, and the arty districts in Stockholm's downtown area.
strTitle: Stockholm Heights and Shoreline: 2-Hour Segway Tour

strIntroduction: Get a taste of Sweden through its cuisine on this 3-hour walk through Gamla Stan, the historic heart of Stockholm. Combine sightseeing and Swedish food in one tour and enjoy both!
strTitle: Stockholm Old Town Culinary Walking Tour

strIntroduction: Embark on a day-long kayak trip to explore the Stockholm Archipelago. You’ll paddle at an easy tempo with your guide among thousands of uninhabited islands, discover the area’s wildlife, and enjoy a tasty lunch in the wilderness.

Discover why Stockholm is famed for its historic charm and natural beauty on a 2-hour city tour of its must-see sights. Explore the Old Town, enjoy skip-the-line entry to the Vasa Museum, and take the ferry over to beautiful island of Djurgården.
strTitle: Stockholm City Tour: Djurgården Island & Vasa Museum

strIntroduction: Explore the home of Stockholm’s hipsters, vintage shops, and latte moms on a 1.5-hour walking tour of Södermalm Island. Discover fabulous restaurants and cafés. Learn about the witch trials and executions in the once working class area of the city.
strTitle: Bohemian Stockholm: Walking Tour of Södermalm Island

strIntroduction: Take a 4-day trip in Abisko. Marvel at the fantastic scenery of the river canyon and the stunning views from the mountain！

Discover why Stockholm is famed for its historic charm and natural beauty on a 2-hour city tour of its must-see sights. Explore the Old Town, enjoy skip-the-line entry to the Vasa Museum, and take the ferry over to beautiful island of Djurgården.
strTitle: Stockholm City Tour: Djurgården Island & Vasa Museum

strIntroduction: Enjoy a Swedish summer buffet dinner on a evening dinner cruise of Lake Mälaren, the third largest lake in Sweden. Savor Swedish specialties and crossover favorites, while an on board DJ keeps you dancing and the views keep you smiling.
strTitle: Dinner Buffet Lake Mälaren – Summer Cruise with Music
The Original Stockholm Ghost Walk and Historical Tour

strIntroduction: Head out from Copenhagen on a luxury mini-van tour to discover the city of Malmö. Explore Stora Torget and Lilla Torget, the city’s main squares. Cross the Øresund Bridge into Sweden and experience 2 countries in a single day.
strTitle: Experience Denmark and Sweden on a 6-Hour Malmö Tour

strIntroduction: Tour the greener parts of Stockholm on board a canal boat and cruise for 50 minutes along the Djurgården Canal, departing from Strömkajen in the center of the city. See historic sights from the water while listening to an informative audio guide.
strTitle: Royal Canal Tour - Explore Stockholm by Boat

strIntroduction: Enjoy a 2.5-hour lunch or dinner cruise to Drottningholm Palace from Stockholm, sailing on board an early 20th century ship. Savor an a la carte menu, see the sights of Lake Mälaren and get entry to the Chinese Pavilion and Palace Theatre on Lovön.
strTitle: Drottningholm Palace Return Cruise from Stockholm

strIntroduction: Take the cable car up to the mountain Nuolja. Marvel at the fantastic views in the arctic circle and the amazing sun at midnight！

Calling all lovers of the great outdoors! Come and see some of the most breathtaking scenery on the planet as we take you through mountain passes, rivers, gorges, lakes, glaciers, tunnels, forests, valleys and much more on this unforgettable full-day guided tour.

strIntroduction: Experience Geneva's diversity, from the international sector to its historic center, on a guided city tour. Add the Mermaid’s Cruise on the lake for some additional sightseeing, and finish the day with a visit to Annecy, known as the Venice of the Alps.

strIntroduction: Explore Annecy, the Venice of the Alps, which features an old town area with colorful pedestrian streets and lively markets. In addition to the picturesque center, you’ll admire stunning mountain landscapes on this half-day guided excursion from Geneva.

We will visit Lausanne, cultural center of Switzerland and a beautiful city built on hills. In the afternoon, we will drive through the canton of Vaud and along the lake passing by the famous towns of Vevey and Montreux.

Everything associated with Switzerland is consistently considered to be the ‘best’ in the world. From army knives to banks and cuckoo clocks, the country has been blessed with the Midas touch. The same goes for its mountains, cheese and chocolates, the three centrepieces of this delicious full-day tour of the east.
The journey takes you to Northern Switzerland, a beautiful wine growing region with charming farming villages and picturesque landscape located close to the German border.
Feel on top of the world at the summit of Mount Pilatus, with this fascinating guided tour to one of the most famous peaks in the Alps.
Live the high life on Mount Titlis with this exhilarating full-day guided tour to the summit of one of the most emblematic peaks in the Alps.

strIntroduction: Explore the old town and international districts of Geneva on a 2-hour sightseeing tour, and see top attractions, such as the fountain of Jet d’Eau in Lake Geneva, St. Pierre’s Cathedral, the Flower Clock, and more.

Get to know Zürich and its surroundings on a 4.5 hours extended city tour. Visit the Old Town with its churches, walk along the beautiful River Limmat, then ride on the aerial cable car for a breathtaking view over Lake Zürich and the snow-covered Alps!
strTitle: Zurich City Highlights with Felsenegg Cable Car Ride

strIntroduction: Experience the natural splendor and cultural richness of two countries on a full-day tour of the Zurich region and the Liechtenstein Principality. With a knowledgeable guide, immerse yourself in a wonderland of sweeping valleys, alpine lakes, plunging waterfalls and scenic reserves as you explore Heidiland by coach.

strIntroduction: Be tempted by the chocolates of the famous Gruyères region on an 8-hour food tour from Geneva. Visit a chocolate factory to sample the goods, with free time to go to fascinating museums, such as the Tibet Museum, and more.

Lucerne, the most charming of Switzerland's cities, is not to be missed. It's not just the famous sights – the Lion Monument and Kapellbrücke – that will enthrall you, visits to the Transport Museum and Rosengart Museum are also highly worthwhile.

The city tour of Geneva will bring you to visit the International part of Geneva through the centre of the world’s peacemaking organizations followed by a tour of the main tourist attractions of the city
strTitle: Explore the old town of Geneva and Annecy

strIntroduction: Join us for an unforgettable excursion to the idyllic region of Eastern Switzerland, the very stuff that dreams are made of.

Enjoy an evening tour of Zurich’s surroundings and get an introduction to Zurich and its forests, ending with a 4-course cheese fondue. Purchase chocolates straight from the Lindt factory and ride an aerial cable car to Felsenegg for panoramic views.

strIntroduction: Climb to the top of Europe with this exciting full-day excursion to Jungfraujoch, the highlight of any Swiss holiday. Classed by the UNESCO as the World Heritage of the Swiss Alps, this breath-taking scenario contains the world’s highest train station and many other unforgettable attractions.

strIntroduction: Make the most of your time in Geneva with the awesome Geneva Pass, and receive free offers, preferential rates, great discounts, and surprise gifts at over 40 of Geneva's favorite attractions, including museums, cruises, and guided city tours.

We will visit Lausanne, cultural center of Switzerland and a beautiful city built on hills. In the afternoon, we will drive through the canton of Vaud and along the lake passing by the famous towns of Vevey and Montreux.

Escape the hectic rhythm of the city for a full day of relaxation in the heart of the Alps, the heavenly Bernese Oberland. Located at the foot of the Kleine Sheidegg, one of the most beautiful Alpine panoramas, it offers unparalleled views of the famous triple peaks Eiger, Monch and Jungfrau – the Ogre, the Monk and the Maiden.
Combine nature and culture in this four hour sightseeing tour of Zurich together with a cable car ride to the privileged viewpoint of Felsenegg and a cruise on beautiful Lake Zurich.
